item.title: Using The Bithappy Browser To Raise Global Bitcoin Awareness
item.description:
Using The Bithappy Browser To Raise Global Bitcoin Awareness

There are many different Bitcoin initiatives underway to boost cryptocurrency awareness. The BitHappy browser is an Android application that is similar to a Bitcoin payment processor. Through the application, users can find sellers around the world to buy goods and services from. Bitcoin is, of course, the only accepted payment method.

item.title: Bitfury Releases Proposal for Bitcoin Lightning Micropayments Routing - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitfury Releases Proposal for Bitcoin Lightning Micropayments Routing - CoinDesk

Bitfury Group, in collaboration with the open-source Lightning Network community, has released a white paper that explores how the in-development micropayments protocol could more effectively route bitcoin payments between users when launched.

item.title: Could a Trump Presidency Boost Bitcoin Prices?
item.description:
Could a Trump Presidency Boost Bitcoin Prices?

U.S. Presidential candidate, Donald Trump is certainly not a man afraid of causing a stir in the world's economies, and that, apparently, also extends to the world of digital currency, namely, Bitcoin. According to a new report conducted by Juniper Research, global concern over the possible election of Donald Trump as the next U.S.

item.title: Coinbase Makes Bitcoin More Attractive to Merchants
item.description:
Coinbase Makes Bitcoin More Attractive to Merchants

Prominent bitcoin exchange and platform Coinbase has revealed new features that it says will make it "even easier for merchants to accept bitcoin." Digital currency exchange and bitcoin services provider Coinbase has rolled out a handful of new features that it hopes will help further bitcoin acceptance among merchants.

item.title: US government to use Blockchain for Health Care issues | HolyTransaction
item.description:
US government to use Blockchain for Health Care issues | HolyTransaction

The US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) could convince the US government to use the blockchain in health care issues, so it aims at starting a study related to distributed ledger applications and health problems. According to a press release published by the Federal Register, HHS is looking for white papers about blockchain applications for healthcare purposes.

item.title: What are some upcoming and/or interesting Ethereum based dApps?
item.description:
What are some upcoming and/or interesting Ethereum based dApps?

If someone were to touch the top of your neck and your foot at the same time, the signal from your head would certainly reach your brain first. However, the brain corrects for this---it purposefully lags a little bit so that you perceive both signals as simultaneous. Your br...

item.title: Bitcoin Startup Among First Finalists in New PayPal Incubator
item.description:
Bitcoin Startup Among First Finalists in New PayPal Incubator

PayPal has announced it is mentoring a Bitcoin startup as part of its first startup incubator in Singapore. Also read: Coinbase Integrates PayPal to Broaden its Reach ONEPAY, which operates as OneBit, will join the nine-month program along with two other fintech startups: Prosecure and Invoiceinterchange.

item.title: What is bitcoin and how it can be earned?
item.description:
What is bitcoin and how it can be earned?

Answer: Bitcoin is a digital currency that works independently any central authority. Encryption is used to regulate both the generation of Bitcoin units and the transfer of the currency. The very first way to get your own Bitcoins was through mining. In 2009, every block mined (every 10 minutes...

item.title: Raketa Watches Trials Blockchain Technology to Fight Counterfeiting
item.description:
Raketa Watches Trials Blockchain Technology to Fight Counterfeiting

Blockchain Engine and Petrodvorets Watch Factory have introduced blockchain technology into the manufacturing process of Raketa watches, making Raketa one of the first companies in the world to record the production of physical goods in the blockchain. Established by Peter the Great in 1721, Petrodvorets Watch Factory is one of Russia's oldest businesses.

item.description: Bitcoin approx avg transaction fee, in USD terms, has increased 206.8% since Jan. 31, from $0.073 to $0.224
